Uses of Package
jdraw.framework

  • Packages that use jdraw.framework 
    Package Description
    jdraw
    Contains the main classes that start the application, trigger the Spring configuration and define the GUI.
    jdraw.figures
    Contains all implementations of figures that can be displayed and manipulated in the JDraw editor.
    jdraw.framework
    Contains all interfaces and implementations of the base framework of the JDraw editor.
    jdraw.std
    Contains standard implementations of framework interfaces.
  • Classes in jdraw.framework used by jdraw 
    Class Description
    DrawContext
    The interface DrawContext represents the context which contains and presents the draw view.
  • Classes in jdraw.framework used by jdraw.figures 
    Class Description
    DrawContext
    The interface DrawContext represents the context which contains and presents the draw view.
    DrawTool
    A tool defines a mode of the drawing view, intended to be set over a tool bar.
    Figure
    Base interface for all figures implemented in the graphic editor.
    FigureHandle
    Handles are used to change a figure by direct manipulation.
    FigureListener
    Listener interested in figure changes.
  • Classes in jdraw.framework used by jdraw.framework 
    Class Description
    DrawCommand
    The interface DrawCommand defines the functionality provided by commands which can be stored in the command history.
    DrawCommandHandler
    The interface DrawCommandHandler defines the handler which allows to access the command history provided by a draw model.
    DrawContext
    The interface DrawContext represents the context which contains and presents the draw view.
    DrawGrid
    A DrawGrid is used to restrict the coordinates used when the mouse is clicked.
    DrawModel
    The class DrawModel represents the model of a drawing, i.e.
    DrawModelEvent
    An event which indicates that a draw model has changed.
    DrawModelEvent.Type
    This enum describes the type of event.
    DrawModelListener
    Listener interested in draw model changes.
    DrawTool
    A tool defines a mode of the drawing view, intended to be set over a tool bar.
    DrawView
    The class DrawView displays a graphic model.
    Figure
    Base interface for all figures implemented in the graphic editor.
    FigureEvent
    An event which indicates that a figure event occurred in a figure.
    FigureHandle
    Handles are used to change a figure by direct manipulation.
    FigureListener
    Listener interested in figure changes.
  • Classes in jdraw.framework used by jdraw.std 
    Class Description
    DrawCommand
    The interface DrawCommand defines the functionality provided by commands which can be stored in the command history.
    DrawCommandHandler
    The interface DrawCommandHandler defines the handler which allows to access the command history provided by a draw model.
    DrawContext
    The interface DrawContext represents the context which contains and presents the draw view.
    DrawGrid
    A DrawGrid is used to restrict the coordinates used when the mouse is clicked.
    DrawModel
    The class DrawModel represents the model of a drawing, i.e.
    DrawModelListener
    Listener interested in draw model changes.
    DrawTool
    A tool defines a mode of the drawing view, intended to be set over a tool bar.
    DrawToolFactory
    A DrawTool factory creates an instance of a draw tool and returns an icon which can be used in the tool palette of the graphics editor.
    DrawView
    The class DrawView displays a graphic model.
    Figure
    Base interface for all figures implemented in the graphic editor.
    FigureHandle
    Handles are used to change a figure by direct manipulation.
